meanings.sent1: She loves rumbaing at parties with her friends.
meanings.sent2: They were rumbaing gracefully on the dance floor.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be rumbaing to the beat of the music.
meanings.sent4: The leaves were rumbaing in the wind, creating a beautiful dance.
meanings.sent5: The children were rumbaing joyfully in the park, their laughter filling the air.

meanings.definition: The act of performing the rumba dance.
meanings.sent1: His rumbaing was the highlight of the dance competition.
meanings.sent2: The audience cheered as they watched the energetic rumbaing.
meanings.sent3: The rumbaing at the wedding reception brought smiles to everyone's faces.
meanings.sent4: The rumbaing of the performers was like poetry in motion.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic rumbaing captivated the entire room, drawing all eyes to the stage.

meanings.definition: Moving or swaying in a rhythmic manner, as in rumbaing to the music.
meanings.sent1: The trees were rumbaing gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't resist rumbaing to the catchy tune.
meanings.sent3: The flowers in the garden seemed to be rumbaing to their own silent melody.
meanings.sent4: The waves were rumbaing against the shore, creating a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: The flames of the campfire were rumbaing in the darkness, casting flickering shadows around the campsite.
